{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-145-05-B |Item_parent=Surveillance of communicable infectious diseases |Item_parent_short=Surveillance of communicable infectious diseases |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the performance indicators of diagnostic tests |Description=None |Rubric=Definition |Contributors=Didier HOCQUET,Elodie COUVE,Anne-Marie ROGUES,Alexandre DUVIGNAUD |Order=5}} '''''Sensitivity''':'' proportion of subjects classified as ill (with a positive test result) out of all subjects actually suffering from the disease. '''''"Specificity": proportion of subjects classified as not ill (with a negative test result) out of all subjects not affected by the disease. ''''' ''Positive predictive value'':'' proportion of sick subjects among those classified as sick (with a positive test result). ''''' ''Negative predictive value'': '''proportion of non-diseased subjects among those classified as non-diseased (with a negative test result).
''. {| class="wikitable" | colspan="4" |'''Calculation of the sensitivity (Se), specificity (Sp), positive predictive value (PPV) and negative predictive value (NPV) of a diagnostic test''' |- | | colspan="2" |Actual state of the subject | |- |Test results |Ill |Non-sick | |- |Positive |a = true positive |b = false positive |VPP = a/(a + b) |- |Negative |c = false negative |d = true negative |VPN = d/(c + d) |- | |Se = a/(a + c) |Sp = d/(b + d) | |}
